alert.note: Alert for Spring Mountains-Red Rock Canyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 28 at 2:38AM PDT until March 29 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 2 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO 5 AM PDT TUESDAY ABOVE 6000 FEET... * WHAT...Snow expected above 6000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Spring Mountains including Lee Canyon. * WHEN...From 2 PM this afternoon to 5 AM PDT Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Periods of moderate to heavy snowfall could lead to accumulating snowfall on mountain roads above 6000 feet such as 156 and 157 and 158. Strong wind gusts could also bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will be fluctuating around 6000 to 7000 feet while a band of precipitation moves over the Spring Mountains. Overall, minor accumulations are expected, but there is a low chance that snowfall could lead to some traffic hazards for some mountains roads tonight.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means periods of snow will cause primarily travel difficulties. Expect snow covered roads and limited visibilities, and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
